alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin; Coastal Wakulla; Inland Franklin; Inland Wakulla (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 4:26AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Wakulla and northeastern Franklin Counties through 515 AM EDT... At 426 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 20 miles south of Crawfordville to 10 miles south of Carrabelle. Movement was northwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carrabelle, Franklin, Sopchoppy, Carrabelle Beach, Alligator Point, Saint Teresa, Turkey Point, Bald Point, Royal Bluff, Panacea-Wakulla Airport, Mcintyre, High Bluff, Yent Place, St George Island St Pk, Buckhorn, Lanark Village, Curtis Mill and Green Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Franklin; Coastal Wakulla; Inland Franklin; Inland Wakulla
